titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the O. B. Gilman and Sarah Dow Gilman Papers
Gilman (O. B. and Sarah Dow Gilman) Papers
titlestmt.author: by Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 05:50

did.unittitle: O. B. Gilman and Sarah Dow Gilman papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Topsell, Edward, 1572-1625? ( Historie of foure-footed beastes)

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four series: I. Correspondence, 1915-1947. II. Business Records, 1915-1931. III. Cocker Spaniel Breeding, 1880s-1962. IV. Other Papers, 1931-1937.

bioghist.head: O. B. (Osmon B.) Gilman and Sarah Dow Gilman
bioghist.p: Osmon B. Gilman (also spelled Osman), born circa 1868, was a businessman and cocker spaniel breeder in Boston, Massachusetts. During the 1910s-1920s, Gilman was a stockholder in the Goodwin Car and Manufacturing Company, manufacturers of steel freight cars, New York City; owner of O. B. Gilman Specialty Biscuit Manufacturer, Boston; treasurer of the United Soda Fountain Company, later United-American Soda Fountain Company, Boston; and president of V. A. Nielsen Company, automotive electrical engineers. Gilman began breeding cocker spaniels in the 1880s and with his wife Sarah Dow Gilman (also called Sally), born circa 1866, he operated Idahurst Kennels in Dedham and other locations in Massachusetts, circa 1890s-1940s. The Gilmans were members and officers of the Cocker Spaniel Breeders' Club of New England, Boston, Massachusetts, 1890s-1940s.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The O. B. Gilman and Sarah Dow Gilman Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Osmon B. Gilman, 1959, and Leon F. Whitney, 1965.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: O. B. Gilman and Sarah Dow Gilman Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call numbers: MS Vault Shelves Gilman and MS Vault Gilman. In 2014, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. The collection was reclassed under one call number, and containers were renumbered. Most folder titles were based on information provided by the donors, while some were assigned by Library staff. Folder titles were not verified against contents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The O. B. Gilman and Sarah Dow Gilman Papers contain correspondence, including incoming letters and outgoing carbons relating to O. B. Gilman's businesses, 1915-1920s, and to Idhahurst Kennels, the Cocker Spaniel Breeders' Club of New England, and other dog breeding organizations, 1930s-1947, including correspondence with Leon F. Whitney, veterinarian, executive secretary of the American Eugenics Society, and donor of taxidermy mounts of show dogs to Yale University's Peabody Museum of Natural History; accounts and other papers relating to O. B. Gilman Specialty Biscuit Manufacturer, 1915-1919, the United Soda Fountain Company, 1920-1931, and the V. A. Nielsen Company, 1919-1927; breeding records, pedigrees, awards, and other records of Idahurst Kennels, 1890s-1940s; accounts, records of meetings, membership pins, award ribbons, and other papers relating to the Cocker Spaniel Breeders' Club of New England, 1920s-1940s, including printed catalogs and other records of shows, 1925-1944; show catalogs and newsletters of the American Spaniel Club and other dog breeding organizations, circa 1920s-1960s; photographs of the Gilmans and of dog shows, circa 1930s, and circa 150 photographs and drawings of cocker spaniels bred by the Gilmans and others, many annotated, circa 1880s-1940s; clippings, most relating to the Gilmans, Idahurst Kennels, and the Cocker Spaniel Breeders' Club of New England, 1920s-1940s; and other papers including glass negative photographic reproductions from Edward Topsell, Historie of foure-footed beasts (London: Iaggard, 1607).
